header.topics: Clearing the clutter, ‘my dad wrote a porno’ podcasts, book review, how we each spent the weekend, weather, time, friendships, parties, Fat Thursday & Ash Wednesday, weight, drinking (alcohol), cooking.
header.activity: Two friends talking about various topics (see 9 above) in a restaurant in Tarnow, Poland.

speaker.occupation: unemployed/ Some part-time private TEFL teacher/ Semi-retired
Teacher of English as a foreign Language

body.u: I've got absolutely nothing to tell you
I kind of have in a way I suppose I've been erm today sorting out more stuff
ahead of I'll put that there ahead of erm moving back and erm I dunno I hit a bit of a brick wall really
just coffee or do you want something to eat?
I might have a look at the soups
okay erm yeah and hit a bit of a brick wall in a way cos I I found I just got so overwhelmed in the end and I think it's all your fault
I build you up and knock you down
I know yeah I went to look for this erm this duvet
which I found and then started clearing out that cupboard
and I'm not really ready to do that room yet

and that room kind of led onto my bedroom and that led on again to the office and then erm the towel rail fell off in the bathroom so I went downstairs and got a screwdriver to fix that and that led to a bit of sorting out in the cupboard with the screwdriver

in it and I just had to sit down in the end and I thought oh fuck I can't do this erm I think you know it's the whole thing is eating an elephant and I know that it's a bite at a time and for me that means taking a room
and then starting in a bit of a room
and sort that bit and then next wall in the room
so yeah so it wasn't really happening
you just sort of overwhelmed yourself
yeah so I had a lie down on the sofa
some of erm Terry Wogan's Janet and John CD
which was very smutty but nowhere near as smutty as My Dad Wrote A Porno which was hilarious
what did you think? did you enjoy it?
I was listening I started listening to it again in the gym
and this morning I was just like really laughing
and I just think people are gonna think I'm laughing at them
on the machines I was just like you know kind of really quite hysterical but it's funny

yeah I was snorting on the bus to Krakow yesterday sat at the bus laughing my head off and yeah I'm surprised I didn't get thrown off but I couldn't help it it was very funny and it's it's I dunno it's kind of ironic in a way cos I almost hate myself for laughing at it cos it's so I dunno it's so sexist in a lot of ways but
I think kind of poking fun at it cos it is hilarious just kind of makes up for it and I particularly like the bit where the woman Alice just said stop stop stop stop stop right he pulled her cervix
let me just correct you guys and then she googled whatever and read whatever that really made me laugh and erm what was it? nipples like rivets on the Titanic
yeah three-inch rivets or something what?
yeah so hilarious yeah I did enjoy that
but I can't remember l what it says but it's something like Jim cast aside his somewhat stained black thong
erotic part of that sentence? cos it's lost on me
some of it reminded me a bit was erm when the internet started getting erm quite popular when would that've been? er mid-nineties maybe? when the internet started getting a bit more
accessible erm actually probably late nineties erm no not that long anyway whenever it was I had a computer and I had internet connection at home dial-up modem back in the day
and erm yeah chat rooms started getting going
and I used to go in the Freeserve gay chatroom and chat with all these lovely ladies all over the country and you could usually tell when there was a guy in there pretending to be a lesbian because

er iit would be a name that you didn't really recognise and then they'd want a personal chat and you'd go off for a personal chat and that was fine until they started doing the dirty talk online like sort of pretending you're having virtual sex or something and they're just so easy to spot and I used to I it amused me anyway erm I would be typing out things like erm oh I take off your blouse and oh fuck I've knocked the lamp off
so I scrambled to pick the lamp up from the floor minding my hands on the broken shards of glass then come back to you somewhat nervously
and we'd just be doing this dialogue like
so I'd be doing all of this dialogue online knowing that I'm chatting to this guy and sort of imagining him with his dick in his hand just trying to
that's what I did for entertainment back in the day
you sh you need to watch uhu
you need to watch Closer this film that I told you about before
cos there's a sort of sex erm chat
online on in that and it's it's not rereally a spoiler but you know it's a man pretending to be a woman
trying to sort of chat up another man to sort of snare him er in this strange trap er and you know he's like with a can of beer in one hand and a cigarette just like
and this man the oth the other man is you know really really aroused by this
yeah that would often be the picture that I had in my head would be
of a sort of elderly or older gentleman
you know overweight sat in his string vest with down it
that sort of thing but yeah
ah well so yes that's kind of what that erm My Dad Wrote A Porno reminded me of
I might get some soup if you don't mind
you go for it I had some stew before I left
erm I don't know what er right er
cheers pal thanks for that thanks
yes any other news? any other news? it's been so long since I've seen you for coffee
I know well its been two days at least
so what did I do yesterday?
oh I had a lovely day lovely day
so I went for a lovely walk
about half eight went up the hill and back
it's just nice and I was listening to to s whatever some music and Woman's Hour
just pottering along went on the swings on my own
ah that's really sweet swings are good
better than slides my arse gets stuck in slides these days
yeah I just had a lovely time
er went to no hummus very sad
I checked the near to me it's a bigger one than the one near
yeah and there is another one near me that's bigger than that one
erm then did a bit of sorting out er s organised loads of work didn't do any work but just sort of
put it in plastic wallets with labels on
erm and then I was like
you know what I need? I need to go and buy a new notepad
I was like ah so that means I'll have to go to the shopping centre
yeah cos everything else is closed on a Saturday afternoon
erm so yeah so I walked
to the shopping centre and back
I well I nipped in I nipped in cos there is like that bookshop
but they didn't have what I wanted so
I went to erm so that was another sort of hour and a half round trip
went in a few shops just did a little bit of a pottering
it's like any excuse to not start this work
erm and then last night I just don't know did a load of Spanish dicked around a bit watched a film
called Room based on a book by Emma Donoghue erm
oh yes I know her ex-girlfriend anyway yeah
possibly and it's about a it's from the perspective of a five-year-old boy who lives with his mum in a room
and that's all he knows the things in the room he's never been outside of the room
no TV multimedia blah blah blah?
there's a T there's a TV
erm and he has no sort of erm comprehension of the world outside the room
he's thinks you know there is the room and then there is the TV
and the TV is make believe and all of the people in the TV are make believe but only he is real and his mum is real
and this man who comes every week is real
erm and you know as it progresses you realise that they've she the mother was kidnapped
and imimpregnated by this man and had this baby and they're still in this room
she's been in the room for seven years
erm so yes I think the point of it is that she's sort of waiting until the boy's old enough to come up with some
way they can escape or get out
it's rea it was really hard to watch I've tried to read the book loads of times I've got it on my Kindle but it's like written from the perspective of a five-year-old boy
so the language is you know n it's just sort of written in the style I just couldn't like cope with it
it's just too much for me to read erm so yeah the film's better than this book for me anyway
but I'd recommend it yeah it was quite difficult but
why do you feel so determined when you find it so difficult?
er becau well with this one because erm I'd watched a review of it er by someone who reviews books and films online
er and I kind of really resrespect her opinion and wanted to get to the end
erm this book that I'm reading at the moment's really hard but
you're quite a perseverer aren't you?
I really want to know what happens
and I am a perseverer in general er
yeah I'm more fuck it move on type of person
I don't know where it comes from or where it er sort of stemmed from
but yeah for sure just keep going
mm yeah I think films and books in particular er you know
not all of the time sometimes I torture myself to the end but
not all of the time do I persevere sometimes I just go this is fucking rubbish
erm but I'm not really sure what the
erm yeah so it's not sort of every book and there are loads that I've abandoned
good very nice I went to Krakow so I got the earlyish bus actually I think the bus was I left that house about ten
erm and got home about half eight at night something like that so it was
out for the day which was really nice erm yeah I was seeing from who I stayed with on the way here
cos I think I arrived in Poland on the Sunday and the house wasn't ready till the Monday
I couldn't get keys till the Monday so I stayed with her on the Sunday night and that's so sweet her mum is a phenomenal cook
and you know I'd said to don't worry about food or anything but her mum had been practising vegetarian recipes for weeks

and I can't even remember what she did now there was a kind of ratatouille type thing which was nothing like a ratatouille I've ever tasted it was delicious and she did some other sort of couscous type dish and the herbs were amazing so yeah I completely appreciated that
and that you remember I tell you when I came from I had the runs from Germany
and had been laid up in Berlin for a few days with the runs and just feeling really shit and I didn't wanna eat and I didn't wanna drink
erm but the smell of this food I just couldn't not and it was delicious and then the next morning my runs started again so
yeah how delightful for people transcribing it's like well
it's not the worst conversation we've ever had
yeah well that's true it's probably not erm yeah so I was very grateful for that and I met her two cats who are lovely and so it was nice to catch up with her yesterday
pictures of her cats and how they've grown
which is lovely erm yeah and another friend from erm CELTA also joined us she's just back from a trip to Italy it seems Polish people all seem to go to Italy and go skiing
so yeah well good on them erm yeah it's good because I love the Dolomites and I walked in the Dolomites in the summer erm and maybe I can get some skiing recommendations for the winter
like the vibe round the Dolomites it's nice mm
yeah and hahad s had a meal in this fantastic veggie restaurant erm yeah we had a nice coffee I don't know time's I seem to have spent a long time away from home but not really

done a lot yeah we sort of wandered round a little bit went for a walk it was incredibly windy in Krakow which was a new experience for me erm but the net effect was that cos you know Krakow is in a bit of a dip
and it's really polluted erm the wind just scooted all of the pollution out of Krakow
yeah it's really fresh I think has trouble with her chest and said she was breathing brilliantly
it did go really windy here in the afternoon but during the day was just excellent
I know I felt guilty sort of sat inside but I was like
yeah why guilty? that's a curious word
well kind of cos cos you well I suppose because I just felt like I really had to go out and enjoy the sun
and I was sort of you know I just felt guilty that I wasn't but
I thought well it's too cold to you know really do anything
and there's nothing that I need to do you know
I made these not I didn't make excuses to walk to the shopping centre
and go for a walk in the morning but you know short of just sitting outside what w w where else can I go?
I don't need to do anything it'd be more effective use of time inside yeah but it was nice
yeah I suppose after so much snow ice cold
and very large minus numbers it's erm yeah yesterday was phenomenally warm it was like ten at times
erm yeah I think we dropped way down again today and the snow was really weird I found it strange looking out of the window this morning and the land now is very brown
because all of the snow's melted and it's
well yeah the snow's melted pissed it down this morning
and that was betwee I woke up at about half six and it was throwing it down
ah that's what that noise w I thought that was just wind
yeah I woke up and had a wee at that point and went back to bed
and got up about half seven
cos I was in the gym and it started raining and then it just was like a blizzard
yeah looking out at the brown landscape
yeah and another little blizzard on my walk here today it's very strange
I missed that I don't know what I was doing
you might not've had it I suppose
yeah but Monday's a bit of a ball ache cos I've got these you know it's solid half three half eight
I need to l plan if I plan ch if I plan advanced and upper intermediate tomorrow
and then I've only got to plan the court class and
one to ones and then that's it
for the rest of the week?
it's like it's like kind of like your syllabus in a way
it was like really front heavy
yeah I had yeah I used to do eight point three three hours on a Monday
and spend most of Tuesday crying
so I always have huge I've always had sort of Sunday night anxiety but especially on after holidays
and I'll be a lot better tomorrow if I know or I'll be a lot better tonight if I know
that I've done these two lessons and then I don't have to worry
y do plan to plan them tonight then?
wwhen you say always had Sunday night anxiety is that through your life?
I don't think through sort of school but
probably when I started er a levels definitely at uni
which I found really weird cos uni was sort of such a relaxed environment
whereas didn't have to go that often
and then especially sort of teaching and especially after holidays like I said
erm don't know don't know why
isn't it weird how really time is just time but days feel different? and they do
you know and hours feel different yeah I find even though yeah I'm not working a huge amount by any stretch of the imagination at the moment but I always feel more relaxed on Saturdays and Sundays
it's almost like collecting or connecting into the collective consciousness
well humanity or the developed western world or people or people I know
yeah you don't have a sort of weekend weekday timetable
the only times that I ffeel like this is when I work erm when I work in
and you know there's no concept of what day is it? or when's the weekend? or I'm looking forward to
er and you're on a completely different time frame er you know and I sort of texted my friend and sh like oh I'm just you know in what are you doing there? during the week?
it's like well Sunday afternoon I was like oh of course
mm but that's the only time when you sort of lose erm and I suppose if you go on holiday if you go abroad you lose days of the week
I was just thinking of Christmas yeah
no idea what's going on at all I think it felt really long this year in between
do you think that's because you're in a different country? different environment
yeah yeah and we didn't do an awful lot
erm I didn't do an awful lot anyway erm and it was just sort of like Groundhog Day
like me and my dad going what shall we do today? it's like mm
sit on the TV and eat cheese and watch nothing on TV oh okay
yeah we'll do that then yeah
but it just seemed to go on for ages
I like when time is like that
yeah I'm a lot more when
time's like that you know not e not necessarily sitting around doing nothing day in day out but I mean when you lose that concept of what day it might be
on Friday night I got loads of like drunk messages off friends and sort of ex
ex people not exes necessarily but sort of you know previous lovers
er and I was like oh yeah it's Friday night everyone's pissed
it could be for me it could be any day you know
every night's the sort of same at the moment er which I'm quite enjoying like oh look at all these normal people
I don't have so much of that I suppose cos people my age are usually married with children and doing sensible things
I really don't know that many people that
go out and get pissed on a Friday Saturday night anymore

I got a text off someone who I'd not spoken to for a couple of years and then a guy that I sort of dated a bit at uni it was like oh erm you know how are things? blah blah blah chatting chatting chatting I was like oh are you still with your girlfriend? he goes like oh no we broke up er a couple of weeks ago I was like oh right it's that's w
ah that's why you were texting me
that's why you've appeared out of
what? I was like well I'm so sorry that I'm in a different country goodbye don't contact me again

I had a message today from an ex friend who I hadn't spoken to in a while it's actually well a sort of friend this is who lives in Australia and I went and stayed with him a little bit in twenty thirteen

erm and a little bit into the year twenty-fourteen so I haven't really well what happened? I think well we fell out or he fell out with me erm I'd planned to go again about a year or so later and I think rather than just say no I don't want you to
come and stay with me or I don't want you to visit me or you know
go to other bits of Australia it's a large country
erm yeah he he just what happened? oh that's right my friend in Northern Ireland is 's ex they're ex boyfriends

and 's mum was dying and has now died but she had cancer and was very sick and was messaging this is while we were still friends in inverted commas and he asked me to get a bunch of flowers for for just you know
as a a show of his

affection to let him know that was thinking about him erm and we got into sort of quite a discussion about the flowers and you know what sort they would be and I'm presuming you know being a gay man he doesn't he's not exactly a petrol station bunch of flowers kind of a guy
let's put it that way so I'm thinking you know big bouquet
twenty thirty quid something like that so got some details ironed out and then I thought hang on a minute with Interflora I think you can order Interflora online from any country
and it's the same price so I said well why don't you do that or at least check it out
then you can pick them mm
and then you can pick them make sure you get exactly what you want cos you're a gay man and whatever I pick is never gonna be right

erm and he he wrote back and er it turned into being all about money all of a sudden which hadn't even crossed my mind erm and he said words to the effect of if you're such a cheapskate you're refusing to go and buy a bunch of flowers to give to a friend in need whose mum's died then you're no friend of mine
so this is all on Whatsapp erm or Viber or whatever
free free messaging erm so yeah I'm messaging back what the very fuck? what what are you on?
what planet are you on? what are you on about? when did this become about money? this is about you getting to choose the bouquet
that you would like to your specifications nothing to do with money of course I'll spend out on these things er it sounded like he was wanting the equivalent of a petrol station bunch of flowers
and you know I didn't gather that from the conversation that we'd had so anyway he fell out with me erm and he's been known to do that with other friends and family members
throughout his life and I kind of in a way always wondered when it would be my turn because you know as as friends go I observed how he was not so consistent with other people
and surprised in a way that he had been consistent with me over more than a decade erm so I'm not quite sure well how it became my turn

erm but yes anyway so that was that for the friendship and then months and months and months passed and I got a drunken barrage of texts after that I'm really sorry can you ever forgive me? and blah blah blah so I said of course you know it's no problem you're a bit of a twat but I still love you erm and then that was the end of that didn't hear from him for months and then got a message today sorry to hear Terry Wogan's died I thought of you kiss kiss kiss like nothing's happened
did like Terry Wogan of course but yeah I just thought that's a little bit on the random side so
people who I've fallen out with and there's only one person that I can think of sort of relatively recently I don't fall out I just sort of
not because of a reason just because that's how
life and friendships work and develop and relationships
you drift in you drift out

yeah yeah yeah sure er but there was er one of my friends he was my boss er when I worked in one of my many retail jobs er we've known each other for years and we got on well er and he was having a birthday party this was last year so I'd come back home from Poland for Christmas er and he was having this party and I just didn't wanna go
and I was like oh I should go but you know it was a fancy dress party which I'm sort of fundamentally against anyway because it requires more effort than is
do you know what I mean?
I know it's sort of s quite selfish
and people often spend a lot of money on these things
yeah but why would I wanna spend money on something that I'm never gonna use again?
I don't have the sort of it's not that I I'm obsessed with time I don't have the time to hand make a costume

I'm not a Blue Peter presenter I don't give a fuck erm and I just thought oh you know what? I can't even be bothered and I'd have to sort of go on public transport in this costume or you know carry carry my costume in a bag and get changed in the toilet
and I just think this is a waste of my life er
said I'm er you know I'm ill I'm not gonna come I'm sorry sorry like I couldn't just say I should probably have just told the truth and said I don't wanna become you know blah blah blah
erm you know he s didn't reply but s changed his Facebook status the next day and it was like well things like this you realise who your friends are
and there were like people uploading pictures of the party and there were like five people you know I suppose he has learnt it's not who your friends are but it's just organising
yeah yeah so was it his it was his party?
so he maybe didn't have any concept of it being a difficult thing
for a lot of people particularly those that had to travel by public transport
it took ages for me to go I'm really sorry I didn't come to your party blah blah blah and he was like it was so shit no one came and I was like well
oh that's awkward but you know not to put all the blame on you but I think it's your fault
never organise fancy dress costume parties
and you can't make it up?
we've met up since then but you know we've sort of fallen out of touch again
er but at least it's on good grounds
kind of how it is with me and cos we sort of fell in again after his drunken apologetic text
but I feel like something's been lost
that probably won't be recaptured I sort of feel a
betrayal in a lot of ways
but it seemed quite illogical and irrational to me when he said oh you're not my friend
yeah but er yes and he deleted lots and lots of people from Facebook and
I think it's the sort of point of this is that don't have fancy dress parties number one
don't have parties where you have to for example pay a deposit for the venue
have a party in a pub where you don't have to pay any money
you just go to the pub
and the pub is glad of the custom
er but don't put any you know it's not necessarily about money but don't put any effort er don't put any money into something where there is absolutely no guarantee that people will attend
isn't the same as them actually coming on the day
yeah so he'd paid for a venue as well? oh goodness
so I think that's another reason why
he was really pissed off which you know it's every he's got every right to
had he forked out for a buffet or booze and stuff like that?
I think yes I think his like mum had done a buffet or something
I know it's really sad but
yeah it is he maybe would've been better off getting a few friends to help him organise it
and then the friends would've been sufficiently invested A to come and B to make sure a few of their friends also came
but I mean I'm really against I'm really against parties
but I am I've never had a party the closest I came to a party was when I was twenty-one
and we went to the races and we all had like a pie and chips and a pint
yeah bet some money on some dogs and then that was it we went home
oh I've only held one I mean you know I've had dinner parties and stuff
people in Northern Ireland don't really do dinner parties so I haven't really
but I'd never like hire a venue I mean
no I've done that once that was erm cos me and ran off and got married we had a civil partnership in city hall
and erm yeah we didn't invite anyone and that kind of sucked but the key reason was 's elderly mother who's a staunch Presbyterian
and who at one point in her life had told she was an abomination

I think that was at the point where she'd been with the German who I'm still friends with he's a lovely guy erm for ten years and I think had plans in her mind of the beautiful babies they'd have together
and the beautiful wedding blah blah blah
and then left for and that's when it all got a bit pear-shaped
and was the evil alcoholic erm and she was there with her for ten years and I think that's probably when her cancer started

she should've got the hell out of there sooner but I don't think her parents or her friends really liked it sounds like she wasn't a particularly nice person so god knows what was doing with her anyway erm yeah that was kind of when that w all all happened so when we got married erm my mum was sick in the UK with cancer 's mum wasn't really very
approving so we just didn't tell anyone
then we realised we needed a couple of witnesses erm so we asked and 's work colleagues
who were two of my G six girls erm they're great and so they came along as witnesses there were just the four of us that knew so
we ran off and did it on a Friday afternoon in city hall and a lot of it was about sort of getting the paperwork because we
had a fair idea that wouldn't live much longer with her cancer and in fact she made it another two years after our wedding
erm so we wanted to make sure we had that paperwork in place erm but it turned into you know we really felt something on the day which we were surprised to feel
because we'd sort of thought it was a tick box exercise
yeah just doing it sort of mm

but it became more than that and then we thought well hang on a minute you know we really need to be having a bit of a celebration and I and you know invite our friends over at least whether our families choose to come
or are able to come or not
so we actually had our a party erm we got married in July twenty eleven

had the party in May twenty twelve gave everybody enough notice there's from South Africa there were loads of Germans there were people from the Netherlands so people came from all over the world and in the end erm 's mum and dad did come
and 's dad gave a speech basically welcoming me to the family
and saying how they were really happy that was happy and that was sort of r erm quite an amazing moment really so anyway so that's a very long story
that's the one and only time I've hired a venue erm we had local diddley-eye musicians from the local pub
played for us we slipped them a few quid we had a dead pig on a spit thing
erm both and I are veggies but that went down a storm with the meat eaters particularly the Germans who tend to like a lot of meat
yeah erm yeah lots of veggie options for us veggies erm actually I think we had two caterers the pig was one lot and then we had sort of buffet things as well
got a local guy to do the disco which was hilarious

it was really awful music awful music erm but we kind of knew that and he was one of my neighbours in this little out of nowhere village and what was kind of funny as well he was a youngish guy called who's probably late twenties I guess and he had this erm sort of bottom of the peninsula girlfriend who was just all boobs and arse
and letting it all hang out and the two of them were hilarious sort of kissing behind the the decks
it was it was just like a scene out of a cheesy comedy show or something

it was hilarious it was just perfect you know perfect for you know that venue
in that place at that time everything was brilliant great night
